Authors: Widjaja N.D., Imam K., Mariani M.
Title: A study of Green IT awareness among IT professionals in Indonesia
Source title: Business Transformation through Innovation and Knowledge Management: An Academic Perspective - Proceedings of the 14th International Business Information Management Association Conference, IBIMA 2010
Authors with affiliations: Widjaja, N.D., Binus International University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Imam, K., Binus International University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Mariani, M., Binus International University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The awareness of IT professionals to Green IT is important to be studied in order to measure whether they are ready to implement Green IT or not. Many countries already implemented Green IT initiatives to reduce carbon emissions. Studied about the level of awareness of Green IT has been done in many countries, except Indonesia. Indonesia has committed to reduce carbon emission by 26% in 2020 and Green IT is one of the potential ways to be implemented to achieve the goal. This proposed paper is going to use survey that has been done previously by RMIT University and Info~Tech to get the level of awareness of Green IT among IT professionals in Indonesia. The results then will be compared to other countries and to highlight the opportunities to increase the awareness level in Indonesia. Following study will be under taken to assess the Green IT readiness index of companies in Indonesia as per Green IT framework developed by previous researchers.
Author Keywords: Awareness; Carbon emissions; CO2; Environmental footprint; Green IT; Readiness
Index Keywords: Information management; Awareness; Carbon emissions; CO2; Environmental footprints; Green IT; Readiness; Knowledge management
